remarks: Any subset of a module is always linearly independent if the underlying ring has at most one element.  Since the underlying ring cannot be the empty set (see ~ lmodsn0 ), this means that the underlying ring has only one element, so it is a zero ring.  (Contributed by AV, 14-Apr-2019.) (Revised by AV, 27-Apr-2019.)
statement:
lindsrng01.b $e |- B = ( Base ` M ) $.
lindsrng01.r $e |- R = ( Scalar ` M ) $.
lindsrng01.e $e |- E = ( Base ` R ) $.
lindsrng01 $p |- ( ( M e. LMod /\ ( ( # ` E ) = 0 \/ ( # ` E ) = 1 ) /\ S e. ~P B ) -> S linIndS M ) $.
